error.signature: An error occurred (ValidationException) when calling the X operation

verdict.summary: AWS API validation failed. Wrong parameter format, missing required field, or exceeds limits.

dead_ends.why_fails: Validation errors are deterministic — same request will always fail
Validation happens server-side — CLI version rarely matters

workarounds.action: Read the full error message — it usually tells you exactly which parameter is invalid
workarounds.how:
# Add --debug to any AWS CLI command to see the full API response:
aws s3api put-object --bucket my-bucket --key test --debug 2>&1 | grep 'ValidationException'

# The error message typically includes the field name and constraint, e.g.:
# 'Value for parameter X is invalid. Reason: Must be between 1 and 100.'
# Fix the indicated parameter value to match the documented constraints.

workarounds.action: Check AWS API docs for the specific operation's required parameters and formats
workarounds.how: Check AWS API docs for the specific operation's required parameters and formats

workarounds.action: Check for parameter length/pattern limits (e.g., IAM names must be alphanumeric)
workarounds.how: e.g., IAM names must be alphanumeric

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'An error occurred (ValidationException) when calling the X operation' indicates an AWS API validation error, while 'An error occurred (ThrottlingException)' indicates AWS API rate limiting.
